reviews.review:
I’ve been vegetarian for 30 years and vegan for about 15. During this time, I heard about this app but always managed fine in the various places I lived and traveled (international and domestic). 

I finally ended up paying for the app about 2 months ago when I found myself in a village in Basque country where there was rarely vegetarian food on menus and a number of restaurants that did have more veg options were closed. No options were listed on HappyCow. Walking around, I eventually found a restaurant that offered a salad that could be made vegetarian or vegan and it was delicious. I took the time to submit this restaurant and meal to HappyCow, as I was very thankful to have found it and wished it had been something I’d found when checking the app. My submission was rejected because the restaurant serves primarily non-vegetarian food, which was disappointing. 

I continued to try to use the app in France and Spain over the next several weeks. HappyCow never once helped me find a vegetarian or vegan place to eat. There were either 1–2 listings with one or two bad reviews or there were simply no listings. 

I felt like I was using an app that had been abandoned. It was a ghost town. 

I’ll keep using Yelp and Google to find vegetarian/vegan food — I’ve had much more luck with these free tools.

Edit in response to developer response: I appreciate that this is a small team; however, the app was a disappointment for me, a vegan, and my personal experience is that Yelp and Google are more accurate and up to date.
reviews.potential_idea: Enhance the app's search and filtering capabilities to include more granular options for identifying restaurants with flexible vegetarian/vegan options, even if not exclusively vegetarian/vegan establishments.

reviews.review:
Gameplay is good. Interface is fine. “AI” players can take 30-60 seconds just to decide to take 2 cards. Far too long for a single player game. Haven’t tried non battery saving mode so that might help, but if you want to sit down and bang out a few games in 30 minutes, this isn’t your game.

Update: Battery save mode off didn’t appreciably speed up the game. But it caused the battery drop from 73% to 45% in a single game. I’ll be holding off on the DLC until they address these issues. There was previously a better version of this game that they removed in favor of one with micro-transactions. Too bad, that version was amazing, and still had the other expansions available to buy. I don’t know if it was the same company or not, but a clear example of removing a successful version and replacing it with a marginally functional one with higher revenue potential.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce an option for significantly faster AI turns, potentially by reducing AI decision-making complexity or allowing users to queue certain AI actions.

reviews.review:
Haven’t seen much good things added in terms of features or bugfixes in a looooong time. 

- sending media from Photos app requires you to wait for the media to be encoded before you can add captions. You need to keep the send dialogue open until everything is sent, otherwise you loose your captions and you have to share from pictures again
- when sending multiple images/videos and one fails (eg network timeout), all media “after” that are lost and you have to share again from Photos app. 
- randomly people can’t receive/send messages for non-obvious reasons. No error messages whatsoever. We found out by accident when speaking IRL. Trusting the other’s Threema IDs resolved it
- extremely limited set of reaction emojis. Why can’t I use the full emoji pallet to express my emotions
- can’t port data backups from android to iOS???
- when you are offline for some time and get online again you are spammed by notifications, instead of Threema batching them in a single notification/one per chat

Threema for Desktop is the only good addition that I’ve seen in 5+ years. 

I don’t see a reason to pay for Threema when there are better alternatives (Signal being the obvious one)
reviews.potential_idea: Implement intelligent batching of notifications for offline users to consolidate them into single, actionable alerts per chat, preventing overwhelming spam upon reconnection.

reviews.app_name: e-Sword LT: Bible Study to Go
reviews.review:
Here are my three main groups with this app…

1. This is not a KJV with Apocrypha because it’s missing books. It’s missing history of Susanna, Bel Of The dragon and the Prayer of Mannesah.
2. Unlike other Bible apps, it does not sink across your different devices. He wants you to pay a fee for each device like your desktop, iPad and iPhone. Why not charge one flat fee and they sync across all devices? 
3. And this last one could be just a personal preference. Why do I have to hold down the scripture every time to add adjustments to a note already established. I should be able to click on that note one time to add or delete commentary or precepts.

Lastly, I want to say that I don’t have a problem paying for this app and it services. It has potential. But the fact that I’m paying for a app that’s incomplete in my opinion because it’s missing books is unfair. Hopefully there will be some updates that can get this fixed.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a flexible subscription model that allows users to pay a one-time fee for app synchronization across all their devices, and offer a KJV Bible version with Apocrypha including the books of Susanna, Bel Of The Dragon, and the Prayer of Manasseh.

reviews.review:
I was lead into this game because I wanted to play the zombie and vampire scenarios, but quickly learned they are added dlc even though they are in the game images without mentioning that.
I play a lot of world conquering games like CIV fand EU4, so I u Der stand the basics of this type of game.  However I found this game to be quite difficult from the very beginning and all the maps are locked behind either beating the previous level on a certain difficulty or a paywall.  I know people will say ‘get good’, but the game also doesn’t do a good job of giving you hints on how to improve and all the bonus items are again locked behind a paywall so you can’t even grind for them.  This game is a big disappointment due to the learning curve.  And if I don’t want to pay for the zombies or vampires, you have to beat all the levels on the hard mode.  I cannot recommend this to anyone but the most die hard fan of this game.  I hope the develop has improved on their other titles.

Update:  I beat all the main game plagues on Brutal difficulty and the game only allowed me to play the shadow/vampire plague once and then locked me out to buy even though it said it would open up if I beat the main plagues on that difficulty level. What is the deal.  I know people like this game but it seems like it it always blocking me from trying the next thing.
reviews.potential_idea: Incorporate an in-game tutorial system and offer unlockable content through gameplay rather than solely through paywalls or extreme difficulty.

reviews.review: You used to be able to click on a deck and it would give a description of what the deck was about and the suggested rules for it. Now it just goes right into it with no way to open the descriptions. A long time ago I bought access to all decks. It puts them all into a single giant list that sometimes seems to sort by what you’ve used most recently, sometimes just seems to be random. There should be categories where the decks are grouped and a way to sear CB and favorite decks, but the devs don’t care. If they did, this would have been one of the first quality of life improvements they made. It’s been this way for several years at this point. We used to love playing this game and I still do, but I find myself using some of the copycat apps over this one fairly regularly. The final straw that led me to create this review is that they seem to have removed one of my go-to decks “The Bible” this was a popular one to play with my family and friends and now it’s just gone. I get that I didn’t technically own the deck but it is something I paid for, and it’s crummy that they took it away.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a deck categorization, search, and favoriting system with robust display of deck descriptions and rules, potentially integrating a user history or an option to restore removed decks.

I’ve tried reaching out to app developers and get a 404 page not found error. I purchased several packs in the past and then switched to Android so understandly lost those packs.  But now that I’m back to an iPhone my previously purchased and my new ones never show.

reviews.review:
0 out of 5 -As a business owner, I had high hopes for HotSchedules to streamline our employee scheduling, but it has been a complete letdown. The app’s communication features are abysmal, making it nearly impossible for my team to stay on the same page. It’s far from user-friendly—my employees found the interface confusing and frustrating to navigate, leading to constant issues with scheduling.

When we reached out to customer service and tech support for help, the experience was equally disappointing. The support team was unhelpful, and the issues persisted without resolution. After wasting time and energy, we switched to a much more user-friendly scheduling software that actually works for our team. I strongly recommend avoiding HotSchedules—it’s a headache not worth dealing with.

From that point, I worked for two weeks and no one in management was authorized or able to finish my set-up process, citing a lack of customer support from the app.
I have since discovered that the job was not the best fit, and if I would have listened to my gut feeling I would’ve avoided that wasted time, but que será.  The simple fact is this app is a way for businesses to pass the buck onto their hourly wage earners, and I will use my last dying breath to urge people to avoid using it.
Power to the proletariat!

reviews.review:
Was torn whether to give 1 or 5 stars, been playing for 2-3 years and have always thought it was an awesome near-perfect game— easily 5+ stars. Over the past 1-2 months, it has been and still is CONSTANTLY crashing. I submitted a message to support team via ninja kiwi’s website several weeks ago to make them aware if they weren’t already. Before I did that, I had given it plenty of time to resolve after making absolutely sure the softwares for both the game and my iPhone were up-to-date. It’s been a few weeks since submitting that message, and it is STILL crashing. I’ve been trying to get black borders on maps, and in EVERY CHIMPS ATTEMPT I DO ON ANY MAP IT ALWAYS CRASHES, which prevents me from getting the black borders!! EVEN ON THE BASIC HARD DIFFICULTY LEVEL, it crashes WELL BEFORE round 80. Every. Single. Freakin. Game. It is so frustrating and it having been happening for as long as it has, as often as it does, has gotten ridiculous. Please either change the freaking chimps so you can still get the chimps medal with black eyes (and thus black border) when the game crashes, or fix the crashes. 

The game used to only crash when my son and I would play co-op and get into rounds 140+, and that would be infuriating and ridiculous when at least one of us would always be kicked and completely lose access to re-join the game. Now it’s crashing on solo games sometimes before round 60, always before round 80, and it completely messes up the opportunity to get the medals/borders for maps that ninja kiwi designed to be a part of the game! Sorry rant over. Please fix. This is ridic.

reviews.review:
They have an automatic selection tool that works in a straightforward, low-tech way (adjacent pixel contrast detection, more or less). That would be fine for my collage- and meme-making purposes HOWEVER you cannot paint directly onto a mask. 

Your options for modifying the mask directly are either A) use the built-in selection tools (with the underlying layer turned off, so you can see the mask clearly) or B) use brushes and black/white to modify it ONLY with the underlying layer turned on. There is no rendering the mask alone in its plain black-and-white form so you can see clearly if there are any spots you missed. 

It's also unfortunate because you lose access to a lot of cool effects that are achievable by applying filters to masks. It's so vexing because you can see the underlying mask in its true black-and-white form in the thumbnail for the mask, there's just no working on it in full screen. So close but so far, very disappointing to omit this valuable feature.
reviews.potential_idea: Allow users to edit masks in a pure black and white view, independent of the underlying layer, to precisely refine selections and apply filters directly to masks.

reviews.review:
1. Add a chat feature

I don’t know what it means when another player "blocks further trades."  Do they want more money?  More time?  Are certain properties off-limits?  Yes, dev team need to keep a family-friendly rating, but surely there’s a way (eg only allowing chat for 18+ users, making it a premium feature)

2. Change the time limits.

It makes no sense to give 30s to complete a turn but only 10s to consider offers.

3. Ban/penalize cheaters and griefers.

No more everything-for-M1 trades.  Trades should be banned after certain events (eg a huge loss), and there should be restrictions that allow even dumb/offbeat trades but prevent cheating (eg, known griefers can’t give away properties at less than 50% mortgage value)

reviews.review:
Ah, the 2000s – a golden era for interactive video games. One of the most iconic titles from that time was The Game of Life. The 2000s computer version of the game was ahead of its time, offering something that felt real, immersive, and surprisingly deep for a game about life’s simple choices. You could pick your character’s race, customize their appearance, and choose who you wanted to marry. The variety of life paths you could take was impressive, and the houses, the cars, the choices, they all felt like actual representations of real life. It wasn’t just about winning; it was about the experience, about making decisions that felt meaningful.

Now, fast-forward to the app version of The Game of Life and it feels like a shell of its former self. Don’t get me wrong, there’s still the basic gameplay of spinning a wheel and making choices, but where’s the depth? Where’s the variety? The modern version lacks the richness of character customization that the 2000s edition had. Back then, you could actually see your character’s individuality shine through. But now? The characters are little more than pastel-colored pegs. Pink, purple, and blue…what happened to the real diversity that made the game so much more relatable?

Also, don’t get me started on the paid content in the new version. It’s honestly just ridiculous how much stuff is locked behind paywalls. You can barely play the game without feeling like you're being pressured into purchasing extra features. The fun is sucked out of the experience when you’re constantly being asked to pay for every little thing. People want to play a game that’s fun, where they can just relax, make choices, and see how their life turns out, not feel like they’re stuck in some endless transaction cycle. It’s frustrating.

The nostalgia for the 2000s version is real. Back then, the game was fun and accessible. You didn't have to spend a ton of money just to enjoy it. The goal should be to capture that essence: a game where you get to experience life in all its colorful diversity, without having to constantly shell out cash for every little thing.

If the creators of The Game of Life want to keep it relevant, they need to focus on what made the 2000s version great. Bring back the variety. Let players see themselves in the game. Let us pick more than just a peg color. Make it feel like life - complex, diverse, and, yes, free to play. That’s the real life we want, not just a hollow, transactional experience.
reviews.potential_idea: Reimplement the deep character customization and diverse interactive life path options from the 2000s version of 'The Game of Life' into the current mobile app, while reducing or eliminating intrusive paywalls.

reviews.review:
To start off, this game should not cost money for how underwhelming it is.
First, they only give you one board to play with the same like six jobs, houses, etc just alternating. This needs WAY more variety. You could be doing so much more with just that category alone. I’m already sick of seeing the same ones.
So I figured, maybe the boards you have to pay for are more fun and I’ll get some different outcomes. The map is exactly the same just different “setting” so the jobs and houses are different, but all the tiles are in the same exact places which is really pointless.
Each board should be different paths or AT LEAST mix up the tiles if you’re making me pay $5.99.
More creativity and random results  are needed if you’re gonna be charging people like that.
Speaking of random results, none of this is really needed if the results aren’t actually ever in your favor. I just played my last game because I played for an entire game where every single opponent of mine was constantly landing on Actions, and they all ended up with numbers over 5 for each attribute while I’m stuck with 2, 3, and 5. Ridiculous. I began to predict what kind of tiles I’ll land on and each time it’s either landing on salary or paying taxes. But never in any game do I land on NEARLY as many “actions” as my opponents. 
What is the point of making this game that is literally meant to be chance and random if you’re gonna have some level of control over my outcome? A waste of time and money. So much work needed.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce dynamic board generation with randomized tile placement and variable paths to significantly increase replayability and perceived value in paid expansions.

If this issue if fixed, I’ll gladly update my review! Other than that, great job developers!

HOWEVER, like many others have already said, there’s content I paid REAL MONEY for back in the day that I no longer have access to. Decks and grips I paid for back in the day are completely gone without a trace. A 3 pack of maps I bought show up but only 1 of the 3 will load. The others say “invalid lighting data”. It gives the instructions to delete the content and redownload but nothing works.

The fact that they are asking you to pay a subscription for all features of the game when they don’t even take care of the OGs who got them to where they are now is a disgrace. 

ZERO BIG BOOMS ❌💪

Connecting accounts is painstakingly hard for no reason at all. Always a problem trying to get Facebook or Apple to connect. The gameplay and idea is there. However I’m afraid the developers are dull and money hungry. Stop pushing for buying all this paid content when it randomly disappears so there is no point. And stop adding new content and not fixing old bugs. “Missing Light Data” on a mobile game map? Seriously? Even small unity developers don’t throw errors like that. Fix it!

I was able to make millions using soy beans. And now I have a tractor for every container or plow (never have to disconnect)
 and I divide up my farm into four sections (upper left, upper right, lower left, and  lower right) which I farm during each month as I change sections that I am working on (while fertilizing the previous section also as I work clockwise) This is a casual and relaxing game highly recommended for low stress cozy gamers. Also, I store all my soy beans to sell in June in large containers with trucks attached and just park and sit them until June. I also have dedicated plows for each of the four sections with tractors attached and all small fertilizers have a mini tractor attached to it as do all of my transport container.

I literally do not have to disconnect or connect anything every month. I just get in the tractor and work.

I recommend doing the German farm into four sections as it is easier.

now the bad… the levels are all designs the same, like the exacts same, same looping background and your on the same highway environment the entire time, wayyy more boring then the first game. also can only get the next vehicles by completing the level, and once you obtain them, you cannot go back to your previous vehicle. because of this you pretty much go the same speed the entire game, the game gets exactly progressively harder with the upgrade of your vehicle, you’ll never have a run that feels particularly impressive

reviews.review: Sadly I recommend against purchasing StS for iPhone.  The touch controls are highly unreliable.  I have fairly slender fingers and I’m dextrous, using iPhone 13 Pro Max, and even when being very careful selecting cards, I still miss fairly often.  The 2nd to left-most card is super difficult to select to discard.  Selecting a card to discard will often result in the wrong card being thrown away, regardless of how careful you are to touch it directly.  Also, after touching a card, it remains weirdly “sticky” — i.e. it often won’t go back into your hand, and you have to carefully click around your other cards, hoping to deselect it, lest it be played.  The issues are fairly constant; definitely recommend not spending $10 on this.  Just play on PC.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement adjustable touch sensitivity and larger, more forgiving touch targets for card selection and deselection to improve usability on mobile devices.

reviews.review:
I adore this game, have sunk a ridiculous amount of hours into it but wanted to come leave some feedback for the devs that the latest update has added a lot of frustration to my experience on iOS (iPhone XS if it matters). Cards in my hand have gotten super sticky - very often when I tap to select they don’t rise high enough up to be able to read the text and I’ll have to tap them up and down 3 or 4 times, often have to tap a different card and go back to it before it’ll pop up properly. 

I’m methodical enough that it hasn’t led to too many misplays, and I’m never too proud to scum save when it does…but it does make my turns take a lot longer and adds a lot of extra tapping and frustration. 

It was running fine for years so I was surprised to see anything change this late into the game. So while on one hand I’m happy to see this game is still getting some dev love on mobile, on the other all it’s caused me is grief lol so hopefully they’re still up for some more tweaking! It’ll be an easy 5 stars with this one gripe fixed. Thanks!

reviews.review:
Update 3/27/25: I really appreciate the devs responding and I also really really liked the app (as you can see from my crazy long review below), but I had to eventually un-install it a from my shortcuts a few days after DL.    

When I had it installed (I have an iPhone 15 pro max, so not a old-ish iPhone btw. Also I use safari as my phone Internet browser) web pages would not load correctly. I would have to re-load the web pages pretty much all the time or sometimes re-loading wouldn’t work and everything on the page would just look wonky. I really wanted this to work because like I said in my review, I have light sensitivity & I prefer my phone to be on dark mode (I can read everything better and it doesn’t hurt my eyes so much) and some websites are now having options to be able to change to dark mode or will automatically change if that is your phones settings. But the majority don’t have that yet so their background will be white. I have “night shift” turned on for websites like that, but sometimes it’s not enough and still will hurt my eyes/give me a headache. 

Anyways, it just didn’t work for me. I had to un-install it because I was getting too frustrated with having to re-load sites, sites looking super weird and sites crashing all the time. I wasn’t really sure what was going wrong but I thought maybe it had something to do with the noir extension and as soon as I turned it off safari started working fine. 
Bummed!
———-

Just purchased the app and I felt like I had to write a review to tell the devs thank you! I have really bad photophobia/light sensitivity, especially in the evening & at night, that causes super bad headaches and makes my eyes ache and hurt. I switch anything I can to dark mode, night shift etc. I even sometimes wear these goofy light sensitivity glasses (they block specific wavelengths of light). For a long time now I was so annoyed I couldn’t change all of safari on dark mode (a few websites I could but that’s it). I found this app randomly tonight and immediately bought and downloaded it. The instructions to install it on safari were very clear and I had it up and running in just a few minutes. The app also has other colors/themes you can choose besides just black which I thought was pretty cool if someone wants to change it to sepia instead or something. Also the app itself looks really nice and I thought for what it does I would have paid more than $3 for it so I appreciate the devs for keeping it at that price. Anyways, ty to the devs for making this!!
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an advanced 'Dark Mode for Web' app that intelligently applies dark themes to websites lacking native support, with enhanced compatibility and performance optimizations to prevent rendering issues and crashes.

While at first this app may have been one of the few around, there are far better resources. Being able to utilize Googles AI allows you to quickly search for specific foods. 

SEARCH: horrible search. I often get nothing related to my search, even as simple as a banana gets mixed results. 

RECIPES: there are maybe 20 recipes. They all stem from white American cuisine. Also, it mixes a lot with being healthy. Having minimal recipes that do not display diverse flavors really cuts your results.

reviews.review: There are free app that give more details with regards to serving size and max serving size. It’s very surprising that Monash doesn’t do the same. Potatoes for example. My Dre app shows the percentage of each fod map it also says how many potatoes ( and size i.e medium potatoes) you can it and it still remain low fod map. MoNash on the other hand says 1/4 cup but up 500g. In my opinion it’s not informative enough and comes across as lazy.
reviews.potential_idea: Enhance the Monash FODMAP app with more precise serving size guidance, including detailed breakdown of FODMAP percentages and flexible portion options (e.g., by weight and count) for low-FODMAP foods.

reviews.review: This app is constantly contacting Facebook, Google, etc. just look at the privacy report.
reviews.potential_idea: An in-app privacy dashboard that transparently shows all third-party data sharing and allows users to manage or revoke permissions.

reviews.review: First of all, there’s no search option. Under the Food Guide, most of the suggested foods are not available in the U.S., at least not at my neighborhood Kroger. I’d love to have help from a dietitian, but I’m not paying out of pocket. I’ll ask my NP to refer me to a nutritionist in my area, one whom my Medicare will cover.
reviews.potential_idea: Integrate a food availability search feature that filters suggestions based on user's location and shopping preferences, and offer a service to find dietitians covered by Medicare.

reviews.review: a useless app that only promotes licensed products, offers little helpful information that isn’t easily accessible or complete and can be found elsewhere for free
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a comprehensive, free, and unbiased mobile app that aggregates and provides readily available information on a wide range of products, along with user reviews and comparisons.

reviews.review: $8 most of it looks "foreign".  No oats/oatmeal? Hmm
reviews.potential_idea: Include a wider variety of common breakfast options, specifically oatmeal, in the app's food database.

reviews.review: I found this app very useful until the latest update. Not only are my previous reintroductions gone, but the text is cut off in the reintroductions window so you can only guess what food you are supposed to be reintroducing. The text is there but only IF you are using the smallest possible font on your phone. I'm an older adult and can't read small fonts anymore. ☹️  This update does not consider the accessibility of those with poor eyesight. It's very disappointing and honestly, not very professional either. It's sad to see this happen to what used to be such a good resource.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement adaptive text resizing and data recovery features to ensure accessibility and prevent data loss in app updates.

reviews.review: I was hoping for a features similar to the Carb Manager App where you can scan and track the foods you are eating and then see the FODMAP score.  This app doesn’t have specific foods I am looking for and is hard to use if you are trying to discover which products in the store are or are not FODMAP.  I am disappointed that I purchased this app, even for only $8.
reviews.potential_idea: Integrate a barcode scanner with a comprehensive FODMAP food database to help users identify low-FODMAP products directly in stores.

reviews.review: Rather a waste of money if you are looking up foods. Many basic food are not included in the search which is what I expected. Not much for the USA. Nothing under oils for Lard, Tallow or other meat fats for example. Most brands are not USA brands so not recommended for use for the USA.  No contact for help with using the app is readily found. Very disappointing.
reviews.potential_idea: Expand the app's food database to include a wider range of common American foods, including specific meat fats like lard and tallow, and local brands.

reviews.review: With the latest update, I can no longer save a PDF of my report, nor can I email it to myself as a copy. What have you done? I don’t understand why developers can’t leave well enough alone. I run into these problems all the time with software.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-app help and support center with clear documentation and contact options to address user confusion and issues.

Now I’m trying to make a new account and the app won’t send me a confirmation email.  I’ve had the app for two months now and I was loving it up until now…

reviews.review: How can you make a person's order when you can't see what they ordered after they order it? The "order ticket" shows two ingredients out of the six or seven or 10 or however many ingredients the person ordered. How are you supposed to use a list of two ingredients to cook an order that contains many more ingredients than that? And the ingredients shown are just icons – there's no indication of what they actually are. So if two or three ingredients you could choose from happen to look very much alike, which several do, you're just going to have to guess which of the look-alike items they wanted. Truly bizarre and unplayable game. I'm going to appeal to the App Store to give me my money back.
reviews.potential_idea: Display all ordered ingredients clearly with text labels and icons on the order ticket for improved gameplay clarity and accuracy.

reviews.review:
The title says it all. My first complaint is the game takes far too long to show variance in runs making it feel stale fast.
Second, the game is far too RNG dependent, the mechanic to increase chances of receiving certain synergistic items doesn’t seem to be effective, you have practically no good choices even with heavy RNG manipulation and dozens of re rolls. Back to Peglin I guess 🤷‍♀️
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a mechanic that allows players to meaningfully influence or guarantee synergistic item drops to mitigate excessive RNG dependence and increase run variety.

reviews.review: I continued to play this game even with my issues below. I finished a run and probably started a few other ones. It's been idk how many days that I have not even thought about this game at all. On one of my runs I watch the claw go down and grab a bunch of items and right when it started to come up one of the items I was going for immediately disappeared. When it's the games mechanic I can't get past it. I will never play this game again and wasted the money I spent on it. I hate free to play but this game makes me want to just play free to play so I am not wasting money like this. I am very disappointed. I like this game. It's pretty entertaining. I just bought it today and I am on my first run. I am on floor 16 and just started to notice stuff disappearing. So 2 turns I watched the magnet drop in the machine and immediately disappear. Third turn it drops lands on the other stuff and when I went to grab it, it disappeared. Next stage same floor I watched stuff fall and immediately disappear. The reason such a low rating is grabbing stuff is the whole point of the game. Can't grab stuff if it doesn't drop or show up like it should. Please fix.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a visual feedback mechanism or a clearer game mechanic explanation for item disappearance in the claw machine, ensuring players understand why items vanish before they can be grabbed.

reviews.review: This game requires precision in aligning the claw exactly over the objects you need to collect yet it makes it very difficult to do so.  If you try to drag the claw a millimeter it goes a centimeter and sometimes nowhere at all.  Maybe that’s by design but it creates a bad experience.  The player needs a left and right arrow he can tap to move the claw in finer increments.  Not going to play this game as it is right now unless these features are added
reviews.potential_idea: Implement fine-tuned directional arrow controls for precise claw movement in a claw machine game.

reviews.review:
TLDR: find another app. I was a power user with things, but it no longer fits my needs. 

I never thought I’d write this. Things has always been the best. Always the sharpest looking. Always ready for productivity. Always in Apple’s spotlight. But Things has been slowing down…

Today, iOS 26 launched. I woke up hopeful that Things would surprise us by giving us a new feature. Maybe a new UI refresh. Nope. Their update was a barebones update to stay “current”. A glass icon and a glassy like plus button. Wooo thanks! 

I have bought every version of things. The visionOS release was strike one. A full price for a multi year app that just has translucent sidebars? Come on. I messaged the devs many times asking what most of us are asking and needing: attachment support, better markdown (the current setup is insanely stupid), collaboration, or even a refreshed coat of paint to not look like an older app. The responses we get? Thanks for the feedback, we aren’t doing it. 

Today, I’m uninstalling things. This big update from them is a joke. To the other devs who listen and keep the magic of Apple software release day still magical, thank you. To Cultured Code, thanks for the great years ranging all the way back to Things 1. You’ve lost your touch, your magic. I hope you find it again and find joy in your work.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement robust file attachment support and enhanced Markdown capabilities with a modern UI refresh to meet power user demands for a feature-rich task management app.

reviews.review: I need REPEATED daily tasks. Pointless app if it doesn’t do that. It’s also ATROCIOUS to find out that if I want it on my laptop I have to pay another $50????? I would really like a refund. I’ll stick to notion.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a feature for recurring daily tasks and offer a unified subscription model for mobile and desktop access.

reviews.review: Disgusting implementation of Markdown, need to hide links and other formatting

Have been using Things for years and liked it. However, just had the worst experience trying to move away from it due to switching to an android phone. While platforms like todoist give you the option to export tasks, Things doesn’t and makes it as hard as possible to move your data out of their system. They give you a database file where half of information is missing such as projects, recurring reminders, etc. In the end I spent days getting a spreadsheet of my information and had to manually go through hundreds of records to update them. 
Unfortunately, I can no longer recommend them.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement robust data export functionality for task management apps, allowing users to seamlessly migrate their data to other platforms or formats, including all task details, projects, and recurring reminders.

reviews.review: The game itself is absolutely fine, a great TD game just like the rest in the series. For me it is a 1 out 5 for the simple fact that they have turned this into the greediest of cash grabs where something like 50% of all towers and 85% of all heroes are locked behind further paywalls, and not cheap ones either. Paying for all of these, event at their “discounts price” will cost you a further $50 on top of the price of the game itself. In other words, they want you to pay the price of a AAA console/PC game to play their mobile game. To add further insult to injury, most of the paid extras towers ar just towers from previous games, so you’re paying an entire games worth of blackmail money for the privilege of using them in this game, even if you bought those previous games. The same is true of the DLC heroes except it’s even worse - even if you ALREADY PAID for a DLC hero in a previous entry it isn’t credited to you in this game. I’m sure the actual designers didn’t make these decisions but the game is a shameful cash grab that’s unworthy of its own legacy.
reviews.potential_idea: Integrate a system that acknowledges and provides discounts or unlocks for content previously purchased in earlier game entries to reward loyal players.

reviews.review:
Nintendo thinks that in every situation where you change phones, you’ll remember to go into this game and use their one-of-a-kind save transfer tool (that keeps your data for 3 days) instead of using the built-in iOS option for completely seamless data backup.

This means your save, which you’ve worked on over the course of a year, likely multiple years, can be completely lost if your phone is stolen, broken, or lost. This is obviously stupid and they went out of their way to avoid using iCloud backup for reasons that I can’t fathom.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement seamless cloud backup for game data using native iOS or Android backup systems, replacing or augmenting the current proprietary save transfer tool.

reviews.review: I absolutely adored this game when it was one of the few game options of the time, among solitaire and minefield. For years I’ve yearned for another chance to play the cake game, hear the sound effects and see the flying clovers… I was so excited to think I could finally relive those fond memories, however, this recreation hasn’t met my expectations, whatsoever. At first I thought $1.99 was a modest price for the revival of the Purble Place I remember, but this game simply isn’t it. Although most of the visuals are wonderful, I feel a lot more effort could have been put into the actual gameplay. I’ve never purchased a game from the App Store before, but I really got my hopes up. I don’t understand why or how this game could be worth the two dollars.

reviews.review: What is it now, 2005? Imagine an app that requires you to have a username and password. You have to come up with an original username so you are forced to try a bunch of things til you get one that nobody else has. Now a few years go by and you want to find more charts so you try to log in so you can access the forums. What was that username you made up on the fly when you first bought the app? Donn’t know it? You are out of luck. There’s a “forgot password” option, but no “forgot username” option. You spent 20-something dollars for the app, and it’s pegged to your Apple ID. You are using the same device, same Apple ID you had when you bought the app. But no, you are locked out. You won’t be getting in. Period.  So many things about this old, clunky app are just like this. Want to name a chart you just created? If a chart already exists for that song on any of the playlists you have previously downloaded, you will not be able to use that title. You’ll have to call your chart All Of Me 2, or something like that. You’ll find the whole app is riddled with nutty appendices on the names of common songs. It’s so freaking cumbersome amd clunky. It’s from a bygone era, but it’s what everyone uses for the time being, so it’s what you are stuck with.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a username recovery feature that is tied to the user's Apple ID, along with more flexible naming conventions for charts to avoid duplicate entries.

reviews.review: I wish I could tell what I think about what this app does. It might just be amazing. Certainly some people seem to think it is. However the needlessly complicated registration process had me fuming from the moment I started to register and after 45 minutes I never did get registered. I don't know whether I hate this app or not, but I certainly hate its registration process.
reviews.potential_idea: Streamline the app's registration process to be more intuitive and less time-consuming for new users.

reviews.review:
I do not understand why everybody raves about this. I have no idea how to decipher these gobbledygook charts. No lyrics no nothing. Just a bunch of slashes and triangles and stuff. Get guitar tapp, it at least has the lyrics and where the changes are. This is terrible. I guess they just assume you magically already know "chart-ese" 
Update - there's no way like in the app it doesn't even show you what your username and password is. This is the most complicated load of garbage I ever saw in my life..
reviews.potential_idea: Incorporate interactive musical notation with embedded lyrics and chord changes, similar to 'Guitar Tapp', to make charts more accessible to beginners.

reviews.review: You can’t even reset your password. It sends you a link to reset your password that requires your password. Bizarre. No wonder I stopped using it a while back. I thought they might have made it easier to use. Nope….can’t even get started.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a clear and straightforward password reset flow that does not require the user's current password.

reviews.review: Every time I open the app it immediately closes back out

reviews.review: Cool idea but not well executed
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a roadmap feature for users to visualize and track their progress towards achieving personal goals within the app.

reviews.review: While I absolutely love this game on the phone, the iPad version needs a fix to the UI. Cuts off item descriptions and you need to scroll down to read what each symbol does. There’s no practical need for this, since there is ample screen to use if it were resized properly.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement responsive UI scaling for the iPad version of the game to properly display item descriptions and symbol explanations without requiring excessive scrolling, leveraging the larger screen size.

reviews.review: I think the base game is great. It doesn’t appear to be updated or balanced anymore but it’s still good. The reason for the low review is that the UI is cutoff and on iPad. It makes it virtually unplayable on iPad. I’ve tried contacting the dev and not heard back. Disappointing!

reviews.review: This game is great, but the UI is terrible on my iPad Pro. The game used to display very well, but an update last year ruined it. Parts of the screen are unused and you need to scroll down to read item descriptions.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement adaptive UI scaling that automatically adjusts layout and element sizing for different screen resolutions and aspect ratios, particularly for tablet devices.

reviews.review: I played for a few hours while trying to decipher good strategies or synergies. I never once got a good synergy going as there are so many pieces. Not a bit of dopamine. And the touch screen buttons had to be hit many times to work?
reviews.potential_idea: Implement an in-game tutorial or visual guide that demonstrates effective unit synergies to help players discover satisfying gameplay loops.

reviews.review:
I know low res graphics are a style choice, but this game needs better resolution to differentiate between symbols.
It is very hard to decipher what each card does, and tapping inside the description is infuriatingly small.
There are some animation speed adjustments, but I want to see the money collected from each icon slowly, so I can figure out what is actually happening. It would be nice to tap to collect the money.
It is never clear when I can use the remove button.
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce clearer visual distinction for in-game symbols and add a tap-to-collect mechanic for accumulating resources, with configurable animation speed for resource collection.

reviews.review: The only way to win the higher ascension levels is explicitly getting lucky. You can play it perfectly game after game and just get shafted for absolutely no reason. Was obscenely easy until ascension level 11, and now I’ve been stuck there for 13 games (literally have only ever lost one other time, and that was on level 10)
reviews.potential_idea: Introduce a 'skill-based' progression system or 'challenge modes' that offer alternative ways to advance beyond pure luck-based ascension levels in a game.

reviews.review: I don’t want this game to seek too much or you might enjoy capitalism too much.

reviews.review: It needs an optimization for new versions of iOS , I have the iPhone 16 pro and the app works very badly for me it’s a great app but it has impossible to use
reviews.potential_idea: Optimize the app for the latest iOS versions to ensure smooth performance on newer devices, specifically addressing stuttering and unresponsiveness.

reviews.review:
I’ve had this app for about 5 years, hopping back on to tweak an old beat or trying something new. Every, single, time, I would open this app, there would be another glitch in my beats that needs updated. For example, the kicks won’t work because I have to reinstall the input, or a certain effect doesn’t work anymore. Now, after experiencing that same issue and attempting to troubleshoot it, I decided to delete the app and reinstall it to see if that would fix it. I’ve done it in the past and it worked out so no problem. Except this time, ALL OF MY FILES WERE DELETED.
Every, single beat I’ve made or worked on for the past 5 years is gone. Poof! Countless hours of effort to craft my own sounds, just for it to corrupt in a bad app and get lost somewhere. I tried recovering them, nothing works and they’ve vanished. Now I don’t even want to touch this app or the computer version. 

Overall, the experience was fun, but I would recommend investing your time in a different program that’s more stable than this one. Otherwise, everything you’ve worked on may be randomly deleted.

P.S. I purchased half of all the add ons, after my initial purchase of the app, and this happened.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement robust cloud backup and synchronization for user projects to prevent data loss and allow seamless access across devices.

reviews.review: This is a new program entirely, nothing at all related to or similar to FL Studio for PC. I spent over 10 mins just trying to make any sound and gave up then deleted. Learning curve is way too steep.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a simplified 'beginner mode' for mobile music creation apps with interactive tutorials and pre-set sound packs to reduce the steep learning curve.

reviews.review: It's so cool

reviews.review: It lacks a lot of features, like synths and basses. GarageBand is better.

reviews.review:
It is really easy to use, but it keeps on crashing and sometimes delete my work.
It’s really easy and I love using it, but sometimes it crashes and is just deleted sometimes it even deletes the whole song.
I hope they come up with an update that fixes this problem .
I signed into the backup, but it didn’t really work 
It’s still delete the last thing I did even if I press save.
I do recommend this app, but maybe don’t put something that you really like on it.

reviews.review: better off with bandlab , waste of 15$ refunded it immediately

reviews.review: 1 star

reviews.review:
At times some of my songs are empty. The files are there, but the songs now have nothing in them except for a blank master track. 

This app is prone to losing data. Use another DAW that is more stable.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement real-time cloud backup and version history for song projects to prevent data loss.

reviews.review: I hadn’t updated the app in a while, and I was curious if anything had changed since I last updated so I went and did that. I wish I hadn’t done that because this app is now borderline unusable. Before the update, placing and removing notes was easy, straightforward. Placing notes is still the same way it was before the update, but removing them is inexplicably difficult due to the way the screen snaps to a position that places the note you were trying to remove on the very right of the screen?? This is especially obnoxious when using percussion since beats are removed when you tap them, so the screen snaps every time I want to remove a beat. The worst part is that the beat doesn’t even get removed when this happens, so I have to keep tapping and the screen keeps snapping until I finally manage to remove it, it is so awful. I don’t know what happened between then and now, but this needs to be fixed as soon as possible because this is honestly just unacceptable.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a 'tap-and-hold' method or a dedicated edit mode for removing notes in the app to prevent accidental screen snapping and improve precision.

reviews.review: This app looks fun and simplistic, but when I PAID my rela life MONEY, all I got was overly complicated piece of garbage, I’m never ever gonna use this app again, when I was going to refund the app, NEWS FLASH YOU CANT, this app is so scummy, I’m genuinely so done, DON'T BUY THIS APP IF YOU WANT SOMETHING EASY.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a clear and accessible refund policy and process directly within the app to address user dissatisfaction with paid features.

reviews.review: Horrid optimization could’ve been done a million times better

reviews.review: eh

reviews.review:
It is a great app for keeping ideas stored on-the-go. I have made the mistake of making full-on projects which gets corrupted very easily and are very hard to recover. I lost a song I worked hard on and I don’t want that to happen again for me and everyone else, it also seems that others experience this issue too.

To summarize, not a great app for making your big projects, just use this to keep your ideas which you can later work on the desktop version. 

Don’t risk losing lots hard work, time, and nice music from a simple decision that can be changed.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement robust data backup and versioning for projects within the mobile app to prevent data loss.

reviews.review:
Recently I’m liking the app, good for starters. But there’s a bug that’s been happening to me and I have no idea if it’s happening for other people too about stretching/shortening audio samples. 

Whenever I tried to stretch or shorten an audio from the apps presets or my own imported audios/samples, the audio shortens the entire sample than where I wanted it to be. Limiting my access to match the bpm and causing me a struggle.

If this was fixed, I would really appreciate it. Other users with the same problem would too.

Thank you!
reviews.potential_idea: Implement precise audio stretching and shortening tools that accurately respect user-defined start and end points, ensuring seamless BPM matching for custom and preset audio samples.

reviews.review: The app doesn’t work. When I tried to get a refund through Apple and explain the issue they refused me a refund. When I tried to dispute the reason the again denied me. So waste of $$ on an app that doesn’t work. Save your $$$ this app is a scam and doesn’t work. I tried in 2 different haunted locations for several hours and got nothing while others were getting things on several different devices. I tried it on a ghost tour also and got nothing. I tried it in a few cemeteries and nothing. I tried it in multiple haunted houses and nothing. Definitely a scam.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop an app that provides clear instructions and troubleshooting steps for ghost hunting, along with a community forum for users to share experiences and device effectiveness.

reviews.review: Bought this app and used in a house with no paranormal activity whatsoever just to see what happens. I was asking questions and getting completely indirect responses. It would just spit out completely random words and phrase that made no sense. Each response would come out about 45 seconds to a minute apart. I only had a couple responses that were related to my hobbies in the house like “can you play music” and I do in fact play piano. However, this could have been a coincidence and I’m not at all convinced that this app works.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a mobile app that uses AI to generate more coherent and contextually relevant 'paranormal' responses by analyzing user input and providing explanations for its responses.

reviews.review: Motion Access Needed: says “motion action is disabled. Please enable it in settings to continue using this app.” It takes me to a menu in my phone that nothing is wrong. Unable to even use this app. Not able to get a refund either.

reviews.review: I bought this app after a  devastating loss and on the first attempt the program would not run. It would open and then crash repeatedly, no matter how many uninstall/reinstall attempts were made. After deleting the app for a few months I reinstalled again and while it FINALLY worked, it requested access to my motion sensor detectors in my phone and there is not such thing on my phone, the app is again useless. I wouldn’t waste a dime on this app.
reviews.potential_idea: Develop a mobile app that provides support and resources for individuals experiencing grief and loss, accessible even on older or less capable devices.

reviews.review: I paid for the version of this app and now when I got to open it it gives me this box that says my motion tracking is not on and tells me to go to setting and they only give me three choices and motion tracking is not one.  So I’m not sure what is going on here but I’m starting to smell a scam . Why would it say something about motion tracking when in over a year it never has before and now it won’t work ? Nope want my money back.  Like now please.
reviews.potential_idea: Implement a clear and accessible troubleshooting guide within the app for common technical issues, specifically addressing motion tracking functionality, and offer a direct refund request option.
